Package controller

Class SimulationManager

java.lang.Object
controller.SimulationManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class SimulationManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

    Constructor used to intitialize some of the fileds of the SimulationManager class

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean checkAClientCanBeServed​(Client client)
    method used to check if a client can still be served
    void generateNRandomClients()
    method to generate random clients (with random values for each field) at the end of the method, after sorting all the clients, their IDs were modified such that there is an order among them
    float getAverageServiceTime()  
    float getAverageWaitingTime()  
    int getCurrentTime()  
    java.util.List<Client> getGeneratedClients()  
    int getNumberOfServers()
    useful getters that helped me in my implementation
    int getPeakHour()  
    Scheduler getScheduler()  
    void run()
    the run method which the main thread (the whole simulation) executes it focuses on the following approach: - it generates the required list of random clients - it starts all the servers (threads) with the help of the scheduler - while the simulation time has not ended - look for the clients that are supposed to come at the current moment - add them to the queues according to the criteria\ - update the current time - put the main thread on sleep for one second to simulate the time spent - remove the clients added to the queues from the list of generated clients

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • SimulationManager

      public SimulationManager​(AppMainWindow frame, int numberOfServers, int numberOfClients, int maximumRunningTime, int minArrivalTime, int maxArrivalTime, int minProcessingTime, int maxProcessingTime)
      Constructor used to intitialize some of the fileds of the SimulationManager class
      Parameters:
      frame - - a JFrame object representing the graphical user interface's frame where the content is being written
      numberOfServers - - an integer representing the number of servers available for the simulation
      numberOfClients - - an integer representing the number of clients available for the simulation
      maximumRunningTime - - an integer representing the number of seconds a simulation will be running for
      minArrivalTime - - an integer representing the minimum time a client will appear to be served
      maxArrivalTime - - an integer representing the maximum time a client can come to be served
      minProcessingTime - - an integer representing the minimum amount of seconds a client can take in order to be served
      maxProcessingTime - - an integer representig the maximum amount of seconds a client can take in order to be served

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      the run method which the main thread (the whole simulation) executes it focuses on the following approach: - it generates the required list of random clients - it starts all the servers (threads) with the help of the scheduler - while the simulation time has not ended - look for the clients that are supposed to come at the current moment - add them to the queues according to the criteria\ - update the current time - put the main thread on sleep for one second to simulate the time spent - remove the clients added to the queues from the list of generated clients
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable

    • checkAClientCanBeServed

      public boolean checkAClientCanBeServed​(Client client)
      method used to check if a client can still be served
      Parameters:
      client - - the client we need to see if it can be served
      Returns:
      a boolean value - true in case it can, otherwise false

    • generateNRandomClients

      public void generateNRandomClients()
      method to generate random clients (with random values for each field) at the end of the method, after sorting all the clients, their IDs were modified such that there is an order among them

    • getNumberOfServers

      public int getNumberOfServers()
      useful getters that helped me in my implementation
